Description: Reconstructed North Ionian black-figured hemispherical pottery bowl. At rim outside, animal frieze, a siren, head reverted, between seated griffins; florals at handle join; below, meander hooks between bands; in lower frieze, lotus and reversed palmette band; more meander hooks, and rays at base. The interior and handles are monochrome black.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The vessel was presumably restored at the British Museum prior to being shipped to Boston
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 38, p. 41, pl. VII, no. 5)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 217, no. 51)

Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1017, pl. 125)
